sn7.13:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha was afflicted by winds.
sn7.13:1.4: Then the Buddha said to Upavāṇa,
sn7.13:1.5: “Please, Upavāṇa, find some hot water for me.”
sn7.13:1.6: “Yes, sir,” replied Upavāṇa. He robed up, and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of the brahmin Devahita, and stood silently to one side.
sn7.13:2.2: shaven, wrapped in his outer robe.
sn7.13:2.3: What do you want? What are you looking for?
sn7.13:2.4: What have you come here to ask for?”
sn7.13:3.1: “The perfected one, the Holy One in the world,
sn7.13:3.2: the sage is afflicted by winds.
sn7.13:3.4: give it to the sage, brahmin.
sn7.13:4.1: I wish to bring it to the one
sn7.13:4.2: who is esteemed by the estimable,
sn7.13:5.1: Then Devahita had a man fetch a carrying-pole with hot water. He also presented Upavāṇa with a jar of molasses.
sn7.13:5.2: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to the Buddha and bathed him with the hot water. Then he stirred molasses into hot water and presented it to the Buddha.
sn7.13:5.3: Then the Buddha’s illness died down.
sn7.13:6.1: Then the brahmin Devahita went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.13:6.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn7.13:6.3: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn7.13:7.1: “Where should you give an available gift?
sn7.13:7.2: Where is a gift very fruitful?
sn7.13:7.3: How does one who is donating
sn7.13:7.4: ensure the success of their religious donation?”
sn7.13:8.2: and sees heaven and places of loss,

sn7.13:9.1: Here you should give an available gift;

sn7.13:10.1: When he had spoken, the brahmin Devahita said to the Buddha,
sn7.13:10.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
